result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander C. D. Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation today. Probation may petition for early discharge after 1 year and all fines/costs/restitution have been paid in full to COCC.

miscConds.notes:
Must follow rules/conditions/recommendations of probation.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied and may be used toward start of payment plan.

$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied and may be used toward start of payment plan.

$690.54 to Menards with a 10% surcharge to the District Attorney office, 5% surcharge to the Clerk of Circuit Court.  To be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Bond to be applied and may be used toward start of payment plan.

Not to have contact with Menards-St Croix Falls WI.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release, no good time. Stayed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander C. D. Otis

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Alexander C. D. Otis in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Alexander C. D. Otis.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. 
Count 2-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Counts 1/3-DRI
CT finds def waiving PSI. 

SENTENCE:
Count 2-w/h, probation up to 2 yrs. Must follow rules of supervision. Must report to probation today. May petition for early discharge after 1 yr & all fines/costs/rest. has been paid in full. 6 mo CT-sub to WR, no GT-stayed. 3 days credit. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $290.60 fine. Restitution to Menards $690.54 with surcharge to DA office & COCC. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. Not to have contact with Menards-SCF. Bond to be applied & may be used toward start of PP. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 
PCR. 10:41 am adj.

9: 55 AM Defendant Alexander C. D. Otis in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Alexander C. D. Otis.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk Atty Burger - WOPH. CT. questions DE. DE - WOPH. CT. finds DE FVI&K waives PH and accepts waiver, PC found, DE bound over ARGN: Atty Burger waives reading, enters NG plea, WST. Defense is preserved on all prearraignment rights for 15 days. CT. bond cont. 9:58 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Recess for PD to talk with DE.  Qualifies.  Waives reading.  ADA Webster addresses Ct.  Atty Burger addresses CT.   CT sets bond.  Bond continues.  1:37 adj.
